de.polygonal.ds.Array3<T>

type
class
implements
Collection<T>

A three-dimensional array based on a rectangular sequential array.

Worst-case running time in Big O notation

Constructor

new(width : Int, height : Int, depth : Int)

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid width, height or depth (debug only).
Creates a three-dimensional array with dimensions width, height and depth.
The minimum size is 2x2x2.

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

reuseIterator : Bool

If true, reuses the iterator object instead of allocating a new one when calling iterator().
The default is false.
If true, nested iterations are likely to fail as only one iteration is allowed at a time.

Instance Methods

assign(C : Class<T>, ?args : Array<Dynamic>) : Void

parameters
C the class to instantiate for each element.
args passes additional constructor arguments to the class C.
Replaces all existing elements with objects of type C. n

inline cellOf(x : T, cell : Array3Cell) : Array3Cell

parameters
cell stores the result.
returns
a reference to cell.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError cell is null (debug only).
Returns the cell coordinates of the first occurrence of the element x or null if element x does not exist. n

inline cellToIndex(cell : Array3Cell) : Int

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError cell index out of range or cell is null (debug only).
Computes an array index into the linear array from the cell coordinates. 1

inline clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

Clears this three-dimensional array by nullifying all elements.
The purge parameter has no effect. 1 or n if purge is true

clone(?assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, the clone() method is called on each element. In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier a custom function for copying elements. Replaces element.clone() if assign is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only).
Duplicates this three-dimensional array. Supports shallow (structure only) and deep copies (structure & elements).

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this three-dimensional array contains the element x. n

fill(x : T) : Void

Replaces all existing elements with the instance of x. n

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all elements for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional). n

inline get(x : Int, y : Int, z : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x/y/z out of range (debug only).
Returns the element that is stored in column x, row y and layer z. 1

inline getArray() : Array<T>

Grants access to the rectangular sequential array storing the elements of this three-dimensional array.
Useful for fast iteration or low-level operations. 1

inline getAt(cell : Array3Cell) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x/y/z out of range (debug only).
Returns the element that is stored in column cell.x, row cell.y and layer cell.z. 1

inline getCol(z : Int, x : Int, output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
a reference to the output array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError z/x out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError output is null (debug only).
Copies all elements stored in column x and layer z by reference into the output array. n

inline getD() : Int

The depth (#layers). 1

inline getH() : Int

The height (#rows). 1

inline getIndex(x : Int, y : Int, z : Int) : Int

Computes an index into the linear array from the x, y and z index. 1

getLayer(z : Int, output : Array2<T>) : Array2<T>

parameters
output stores the "slice" of this three-dimensional array.
returns
a reference to output.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError z out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid layer or output is null or output too small (debug only).
Copies all elements stored in layer z by reference into a two-dimensional array. n

inline getPile(x : Int, y : Int, output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
a reference to the output array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x/y out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError output is null (debug only).
Copies all elements stored in the pile at column x and row y by reference into the output array. n

getRow(z : Int, y : Int, output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
a reference to the output array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x/y out of range or output is null (debug only).
Copies all elements stored in row y and layer z by reference into the output array.
n

inline getW() : Int

The width (#columns). 1

inline inRange(x : Int, y : Int, z : Int) : Bool

Returns true if x, y and z are valid.

inline indexOf(x : T) : Int

Returns the index of the first occurrence of the element x or returns -1 if element x does not exist.
The index is in the range [0, size() - 1]. n

inline indexToCell(i : Int, cell : Array3Cell) : Array3Cell

parameters
cell stores the result.
returns
a reference to cell.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError cell is null (debug only).
Transforms the index i into cell coordinates. 1

isEmpty() : Bool

Unsupported operation - always returns false in release mode.

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new Array3Iterator object to iterate over all elements contained in this three-dimensional array.
Order: Row-major order (layer-by-layer, row-by-row).

remove(x : T) : Bool

returns
true if at least one occurrence of x is nullified.
Nullifies all occurrences of x.
The size is not altered. n

resize(width : Int, height : Int, depth : Int) : Void

parameters
width the new width (minimum is 2).
height the new height (minimum is 2).
depth the new depth (minimum is 2).
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid dimensions (debug only).
Resizes this three-dimensional array. n

inline set(x : Int, y : Int, z : Int, val : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x/y/z out of range (debug only).
Replaces the element at column x, row y and layer z with val. 1

setCol(z : Int, x : Int, input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError z/x out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError input is null or insufficient input values (debug only).
Overwrites all elements in column x and layer z with the elements stored in the input array. n

inline setD(x : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid height (debug only).
Sets the depth to x.
The minimum value is 2. 1

inline setH(x : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid height (debug only).
Sets the height to x.
The minimum value is 2. 1

setPile(x : Int, y : Int, input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x/y out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError input is null or insufficient input values (debug only).
Overwrites all elements in column x and row y with the elements stored in the input array. n

setRow(z : Int, y : Int, input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError z/y out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError input is null or insufficient input values (debug only).
Overwrites all elements in row y and layer z with the elements stored in the input array. n

inline setW(x : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid width (debug only).
Sets the width to x.
The minimum value is 2. 1

shuffle(?rval : DA<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval a list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive) defining the new positions of the elements. If omitted, random values are generated on-the-fly by calling Math.random().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError insufficient random values (debug only).
Shuffles the elements of this collection by using the Fisher-Yates algorithm.
n

inline size() : Int

The number of elements in this three-dimensional array.
Always equals getW() * getH() * getD(). 1

inline swap(x0 : Int, y0 : Int, z0 : Int, x1 : Int, y1 : Int, z1 : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x0/y0/z0 or x1/y1/z1 out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x0, y0, z0 equals x1, y1, z1 (debug only).
Swaps the element at column/row/layer x0, y0, z0 with the element at column/row/layer x1, y1, z1. 1

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an array containing all elements in this three-dimensional array.
Order: Row-major order (layer-by-layer, row-by-row).

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns a dense array containing all elements in this three-dimensional array.
Order: Row-major order (layer-by-layer, row-by-row).

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Use getLayer() to print the elements at a specific layer.

toVector() : flash.Vector<Dynamic>

Returns a Vector.<T> object containing all elements in this three-dimensional array.
Order: Row-major order (row-by-row).

walk(process : T -> Int -> Int -> Int -> T) : Void

Invokes the process function for each element.
The function signature is: process(oldValue, xIndex, yIndex, zIndex):newValue n
